intro: Physalis carnosa, commonly known as the hairy apple or golden berry, is a herbaceous annual plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive inflated calyx that encloses the fruit. The fruit, which resembles a small, yellow-orange tomato, is edible and often used in culinary applications. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, white flowers. Its hairy stems and leaves are covered in fine, glandular trichomes, contributing to its unique appearance and texture.
